verses.verse: Then the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH1961> to me saying,<WH559>

"Son<WH1121> of man,<WH120> how<WH4100> is the wood<WH6086> of the vine<WH1612> [better] than<WH4480> any<WH3605> wood<WH6086> of a branch<WH2156> which<WH834> is among the trees<WH6086> of the forest<WH9194>?
"Can wood<WH6086> be taken<WH3947> from it to make<WH6213> anything,<WH4399> or<WH518> can [men] take<WH3947> a peg<WH3489> from it on which to hang<WH8518> any<WH3605> vessel<WH3627>?

"If<WH2009> it has been put<WH5414> into the fire<WH784> for fuel,<WH402> [and] the fire<WH784> has consumed<WH398> both<WH8147> of its ends,<WH7098> and its middle<WH8432> part<WH8432> has been<WH2787> charred,<WH2787> is it [then] useful<WH6743> for anything<WH4399>?

"Behold,<WH2009> while it is intact,<WH8549> it is not made<WH6213> into anything.<WH4399> How<WH637> much<WH637> less,<WH637> when<WH3588> the fire<WH784> has consumed<WH398> it and it is charred,<WH2787> can it still<WH5750> be made<WH6213> into anything!<WH4399>

"Therefore,<WH3651> thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH136> God,<WH3068> 'As the wood<WH6086> of the vine<WH1612> among the trees<WH6086> of the forest,<WH9194> which<WH834> I have given<WH5414> to the fire<WH784> for fuel,<WH402> so<WH3651> have I given<WH5414> up the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem;<WH3389>

and I set<WH5414> My face<WH6440> against them. [Though] they have come<WH3318> out of the fire,<WH784> yet the fire<WH784> will consume<WH398> them. Then you will know<WH3045> that I am the Lord,<WH3068> when<WH3588> I set<WH7760> My face<WH6440> against them.
'Thus I will make<WH5414> the land<WH776> desolate,<WH8077> because<WH3282> they have acted<WH4603> unfaithfully,<WH4604>'" declares<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> God.<WH3068>
